Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the statement made by Customs and Border Protection Commissioner Kevin McAleenan, who said there were no reported serious injuries on either side of the border.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the injuries suffered by the border agents, as there is no evidence to support the claim that they were "very badly hurt."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the assertion that the border agents were "very badly hurt."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the injuries suffered by the border agents were solely caused by being hit with rocks and stones, without considering other possible causes.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by Customs and Border Protection Commissioner Kevin McAleenan, who stated that the agents were hit with rocks but did not suffer serious injuries.
